sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The head of the UN's Atomic Energy Watchdog has returned to Zaporizhia, a day after saying a deal to protect Europe's largest nuclear power plant was close.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 130 states vote for the international court to clarify what countries must do to legally protect the environment from climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In his first state visit, Britain's new king begins a three-day tour of Germany, but moving on from Brexit is top of the agenda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Commission's transport department chief has resigned from his position over a scandal involving free flights from Qatar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A clash in Italy over same-sex couples and adoption makes its way to the EU in Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: All roads in the fight for nuclear safety lead to Zaporizhia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency has again crossed the front lines in Ukraine to visit the largest nuclear power plant built on European soil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Its site has been damaged several times since war began and Russia occupied it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I think it's important that we can continue our dialogue. I want to thank you for having facilitated the presence of our teams here since September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Grossi says he is close to getting an agreement to protect the plant from a catastrophic nuclear accident in the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The power plant's reactors are shut down and the electricity required to operate the cooling systems that prevent reactor meltdown is being supplied through a functioning power line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: More than 130 UN member states have voted for the International Court of Justice

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: to pronounce on the obligations incumbent on states to protect the climate for present and future generations. It means the world's highest court will now clarify what countries must do legally to defend the environment from climate harm. But the resolution is non-binding, meaning that there's no need for any state to abide by it if it doesn't want to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ladies and gentlemen, for some countries, climate threats are a death sentence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Indeed, it is the initiative of those countries, joined by so many others, along with the efforts of young people all over the world, that brings us together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And together, you are making history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Last week, UN climate experts warned that global warming will increase by one and a half degrees by 2030 to 2035.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The 2015 Paris Agreement, which is legally binding, set the long-term goal to keep warming to two degrees at the most by the end of this century.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis was staying in hospital for several days according to the Vatican.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The Pope is in for treatment of a pulmonary infection after experiencing difficulty breathing in recent days. Vatican officials say the pontiff does not have COVID-19, but requires several days of therapy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: It's still not clear how long the 86-year-old Pope would remain at the Gemelli University Hospital, where he underwent surgery back in 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Britain's King Charles and his wife Camilla, who is known as the Queen Consort, have begun

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: their first royal visit abroad in Germany. They were met in Berlin by President Frank Walter Steinmeier and his wife Elke Budenbender at the historic Brandenburg Gate. They were then given a 21-gun salute and a fly-past by two fighter jets. Britain's royal family has historic links with Germany. Queen Victoria's mother was German and the family had the German surname of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha until it became unpopular during the First World War. It was then changed to the much more British sounding name Windsor. Six years after the withdrawal of the UK from the European Union, we are starting a new chapter. Around 2,000 trade unionists marched past the Cabinet Office in Prague on Wednesday

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: in protest at a proposed rise in the retirement age.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The government wants to raise the age from 65 to 68, saying it must rein in spending as there's a huge hole in its budget. A nedovedu si představit v 68 letech, abych běhala po oddělení a pečovala o pacienty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Lidi by měli odcházet do důchodu tak, aby si ten důchod užili.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Znamená, že je důležitá ta hranice toho dožití a toho, kdy ten člověk vstupuje do toho důchodu..........

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: ...... If the government succeeds, it would be set four years higher than France's retirement age where there's been massive nationwide demonstrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Commission's transport department chief will resign from his post after it was revealed that he received free flights from Qatar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Heinrich Hollerley was facing an internal investigation after the revelations showed he accepted free flights from the Qatari government, while his team was negotiating a major aviation deal with the Gulf state's own airline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Surprisingly though, he'll continue working at the European Commission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: At his request, the college has decided to appoint Henry Colalay, who is currently the Director General for Mobility and Transport, to the position of Orklas Advisor, as the position is called in the Director General for International Partnerships, and that this decision is effective as of the 1st of April.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The revelations came after the European Parliament's very own corruption scandal involving Qatar, in which the Gulf state allegedly paid large sums of cash to EU lawmakers in return for influence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There's been no evidence to suggest that the European Commission was involved in this scandal, but transparency NGOs have widely criticised Brussels' ethics rules as weak.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hollelet's decision will come as a relief to the Commission, which was initially defending his choice to accept the free Qatar flights, since all his missions were within the rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But surprisingly, it was Hollerley himself that approved his own free flights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some MEPs say that the Commission's response is unacceptable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Is it enough of a consequence if he is just moving from one job to another, basically keeping his same salary?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: I don't think so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: As far as I understand, there is still a disciplinary procedure ongoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: So that's up now to the Commission services to determine that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But I think it clearly shows we cannot have director generals that authorize their own exception of free flights or gifts or whatever, independent oversight. And when the rules are broken, there need to be sanctions, not just a reshuffle where people move to another job with the same pay. The EU's watchdog has already asked the commission to provide details on business trips made by senior staff members since 2021 that were partly paid for by third parties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: An internal Italian clash could soon become a European problem. Mayors of cities in Italy are being prevented from registering foreign birth certificates when presented by same-sex couples. The mayor of Milan Beppe Sala traveled to Brussels on Wednesday to ask for support in his fight for the rights of the LGBT community. On the same day MEPs in the European Parliament discussed the topic that's starting to make its way into EU politics. Me and some other Italian mayor are making this battle because we know this is the law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the meantime, we have our fellow citizens who are asking us to make this registration, to give the right to their child, to their children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the reason for which I am here in the European Parliament to give the right to their child, to their children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the reason for which I am here in the European Parliament is that the European Court of the Human Rights said very clearly, first of all, come the rights of the children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Italian legislation is not listening to this lesson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Italian law forbids the use of assisted reproductive technologies for same-sex couples, meaning children can't have two parents of the same sex.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many mayors have nonetheless been registering birth certificates that come from abroad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's until the Italian Interior Minister ordered the law to be enforced. It's meant practical problems for some same-sex families. But it's just the correct application of the law for the far-right party of Prime Minister Giorgio Maloney, the brothers of Italy. È possibile per la legislazione italiana trascrivere questo tipo di unioni e di conseguenza non è possibile riconoscere il secondo genitore a questi bambini perché è contro il loro ordinamento italiano.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Non l'ha deciso Giorgia Meloni, non lo ha deciso il governo Meloni, lo ha deciso la Corte di Cassazione.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Il Ministero degli Interni ha di conseguenza dato indicazione ai prefetti di adempiere a quella sentenza e questo è il quadro.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Non c'è nessuna diminuzione dei diritti degli omosessuali, non c'è nessun attacco, tantomeno c'è un attacco ai bambini, perché i bambini hanno tutti gli sessi identici diritti.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I bambini hanno sempre la possibilità di essere riconosciuti dal loro genitore biologico.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I bambini di stessa sex hanno ancora la possibilità di adottare, se il bambino è già adottato o adottato da una persona in quella relazione. same-sex couples still have the possibility to adopt if the child is fathered or mothered already from one person in that relationship. But according to the mayor of Milan, this requires a very lengthy and expensive process because in Italy there isn't marriage equality between homosexual and heterosexual couples. The issue of not being recognized as a parent also affects non-biological partners in heterosexual couples who've resorted to surrogacy abroad. Last December, the European Commission laid out plans for the recognition of parenthood between EU countries. But as things stand, its approval won't be easy given the different rules currently applied across member states.
